Job Title: Tank Survey

Location: Brownsville, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Requisition ID: 275531

 Relocation Authorized: National - Single  Telework Type: Full-Time Office/Project  Work Location: Brownsville, TX 

Since 1898, we have helped customers complete more than 25,000 projects in 160 countries on all seven continents that have created jobs, grown economies, improved the resiliency of the world's infrastructure, increased access to energy, resources, and vital services, and made the world a safer, cleaner place.

Differentiated by the quality of our people and our relentless drive to deliver the most successful outcomes, we align our capabilities to our customers’ objectives to create a lasting positive impact. We serve the Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; Mining & Metals, and the Manufacturing and Technology markets. Our services span from initial planning and investment, through start-up and operations.

Core to Bechtel is our values – ethics, safety, quality, people, culture, relationships, innovation and sustainability, and our covenants – integrity, respect, collaboration, trust, and delivery. They are what we believe, what customers can expect, and how we deliver.

Project Overview

Bechtel is partnering with NextDecade to support their vision to provide the world access to lower carbon intensive energy with their Rio Grande LNG (RGLNG) project in Brownsville, Texas.

RGLNG is a natural gas liquefaction and export terminal situated on a 984-acre site on the banks of the Brownsville ship channel. The first phase of the RGLNG project consists of three liquefaction trains, two storage tanks and one marine berth. At full capacity, the five-train facility will have a production capacity of 27 million tonnes per annum (MTPA

Position Summary

Assigned to the Construction organization as a Tanks Survey Engineer, responsible for providing field and office support as required to the tanks construction team. The TPC Chief reports directly to the Project Lead Surveyor (LS). The TPC interprets design drawings and specifications to determine associated commodities and equipment locations and leads a field survey team in support of the tank construction activities in the work area.

Responsibilities

The Tanks Survey Engineer duties include, but not limited to, the following:

 Provide support to the Tanks Construction Team  Coordinates the field work required with the Tanks Field Engineers  Support the survey team’s implementation of the project safety, quality, and environmental programs  Responsible for the accurate layout of construction work, recordation of field data according to job specifications and appropriate methods of performing survey activities  Perform duties of a Party Chief on a direct-hire survey crew  Utilize survey instruments in accordance with Bechtel survey procedures including Robotic Total Station, GNSS equipment and digital level.  Develop and maintain survey data  Interprets design drawings and specifications to determine associated commodities and equipment locations  Perform and/or check survey computations utilizing AutoCAD Civil3D software as required in the performance of duties  Provide Civil and Mechanical project completion documentation including "As-Built" records  Perform settlement monitoring and create reports. (Monitoring Points and Horizontal Inclinometer)  Perform Calibration Baseline checks of survey instruments  Support the administration of the survey work request program  Perform verifications of subcontract survey work, if applicable  Support the 3D Laser Scanning operations, including reality capture  Providing direction and training to less experienced survey team members 

Qualifications And Skills

 Basic Qualifications 

 Engineering/Technical degree and at least 3 years’ experience in heavy construction/industrial surveying, with modern instruments and software, with at least 1 years’ supervisorial experience or 9 years’ experience (in lieu of a degree), with at least 2 years’ supervisorial experience.  Multi-Disciplined Field Engineering Survey experience with tank construction associated earthwork, excavation, concrete, structural steel, mechanical, and piping, etc. installation layout and verification  Knowledge of engineering and construction methods and processes customarily acquired over time through specialized instruction or practical experience  Knowledge of Bechtel’s “Zero Incidents” safety program.  Knowledge of Bechtel quality standards. Must have a solid record of successful project completion with little to zero rework  Knowledge of construction survey principles  Knowledge of supervisory functions relating to industrial surveying field & office activities  Demonstrated ability to always maintain a safe work ethic and work environment  Demonstrated ability to work in a team-based environment, able to formulate a working relationship with survey team members, other departments, contractors, and survey functional management  Initiative-taker, highly motivated, requiring little supervision, and able to work on multiple work fronts, with excellent problem-solving ability  Displays effective communications skills crucial to motivating team members and presenting plans in a clear and concise manner  Demonstrated experience with Trimble Robotic Total Stations, Digital Levels & GNSS survey systems, and Access field software  Proficiency with 3D Survey CAD software, (Civil 3D and Trimble Business Center), including the ability to perform and check digital computations for generation of survey layout data and drafting of as staked/as-built data; generate DTMs and compute volumes  Advanced knowledge of data downloading.  Intermediate level use of Microsoft Office software, including Word, Outlook, Excel, and Teams  Must have experience working on multiple work fronts, working under time constraints, and must be adaptable to changing conditions  Must be able to complete and pass a pre-employment drug screen and background check, including verification of employment and education  Must be physically capable to participate in project walkdowns, which may require the following activities, extensive walking in and around a construction site, climbing ladders, climbing scaffolding, walking on elevated platforms, some at heights exceeding 150 ft., walking on uneven surfaces, climbing in or maneuvering around very small and/or confined spaces, and lifting up to 40lbs without assistance.  This project may have multiple work schedules that are subject to change and may require employees to work overtime, weekends and/or night shift when a business need arises 

Additional Qualifications

 Prior Bechtel Survey Mega-Project experience  Working knowledge of Bechtel construction procedures  Experience with Laser Scanning hardware and software a plus 

Position will be located near Brownsville, Texas, USA

Shaping tomorrow together

Bechtel is one of the most respected global engineering, construction, and project management companies. Together with our customers, we deliver landmark projects that foster long-term progress and economic growth. Since 1898, we’ve completed more than 25,000 extraordinary projects across 160 countries on all seven continents. We operate through five global businesses: Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; Mining & Metals; and Manufacturing & Technology. Our company and our culture are built on more than a century of leadership and a relentless adherence to our values, the core of which are safety, quality, ethics, and integrity. These values are what we believe, what we expect, what we deliver, and what we live.

www.bechtel.com

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, disability, citizenship status (except as authorized by law), protected veteran status, genetic information, and any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

 Bechtel employees are required to be vaccinated for COVID-19 or show proof of a negative test result prior to accessing Bechtel sites/facilities to the extent required by applicable law or by customer requirements.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
